alert.note: Alert for Elliott; Estill; Morgan; Powell; Rowan; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 8:59PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Powell, southeastern Montgomery, western Morgan, southeastern Bath, east central Estill, Menifee, Rowan, northern Wolfe and western Elliott Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 858 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a gust front out ahead of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Triplett to near Young Springs to Hope to Camargo. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Cornwell, Rothwell, Cedar Groves, Yale, Means, Ratlitt, Zilpo, Cogswell, Sudith and Lick Fork around 905 PM EDT. Frenchburg, Fagan, Scranton, Bangor and Paragon around 910 PM EDT. Stanton, Vale, Elliottville, Dan, Tabor, Big Woods and Crix around 915 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Wellington, Campsites in the Indian Creek area of the Daniel Boone National Forrest, Artville, Wagner, Korea, Minor, Bowen, Wagner Store, Haystack, Cat Creek, Red River Gorge, Lombard, Ezel, Lytten, Fannin Valley, Blairs Mills, Omer, Stoll, Pomeroyton, Knowlton, Sandy Hook, Henry, Slade, Nada, Koomer Ridge Campground, Jenson, Pekin, Maytown, Rogers Chapel, New Cummer, Murphyfork, Natural Bridge S.P., Rexville, Pine Ridge, Glencairn, Little Sandy, Mize, Calaboose, Toliver, Pilot, Campton, Daysboro, Torrent, Standing Rock, High Falls, Hazel Green, Rogers, Demund, Nickell and Stillwater. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 20 and 48. Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 134 and 149. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Cave Run Lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
